## PHQ-9 vs MFQ: A Comparative Analysis Using Harmony

The comparison and harmonising of questionnaire items between PHQ-9 (Patient Health Questionnaire, a standard for assessing mental disorders) and MFQ (Mood and Feelings Questionnaire, primarily used for gauging depressive symptoms in children and adolescents) can prove quite complex and time-consuming when done manually. However, with Harmony, the task of harmonising items in PHQ-9 vs MFQ becomes more efficient and less subjective.



{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare PHQ-9 and MFQ " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

## You may also be interested in these harmonisations

* [Beck Anxiety Inventory vs SCARED (adult)](/compare-harmonise-instruments/beck-anxiety-inventory-vs-scared)
* [DUDIT vs ASSIST](/compare-harmonise-instruments/alcoholism/dudit-vs-assist)
* [CES-D vs Beck Anxiety Inventory](/compare-harmonise-instruments/ces-d-vs-beck-anxiety-inventory)


Harmony is a tool that uses progressive natural language processing and artificial intelligence technologies to simplify the harmonisation process. Harmony's ability to provide a percentage match between the questionnaire's items means that the overall comparison of PHQ-9 vs MFQ is streamlined.

## Compare the items in PHQ-9 and MFQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import PHQ-9 and MFQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PHQ-9 into Harmony</a> - compare PHQ-9 with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just MFQ into Harmony</a> - compare MFQ with other instruments


This software not only quickens the process but also ensures a higher degree of accuracy than manually comparing the two questionnaires. Hence, using Harmony for the evaluation of PHQ-9 vs MFQ presents clear advantages for psychologists and researchers, saving them from the tedious tasks of manual harmonisation and errors in comparison. Furthermore, Harmony's innovative feature to compare items in multiple languages enhances its usability on a global scale. This feature can prove particularly beneficial while comparing PHQ-9 vs MFQ in non-English speaking populations, hence increasing the scope and validity of studies. All of this can be accomplished within a user-friendly interface where you can easily select instruments from a broad database or upload your own in a PDF format.
